1 million layers ?? That is (very) unlikely, since the tamahagane would
hav=
e had to be folded 20 or 21 times depending how you count. The point
being =
that everytime the steel is folded you are adding carbon (and
losing impuri=
ties), making it tougher / harder and thus more difficult
to fold each time=
, and making the swords cutting edge eventually more
brittle. (the inner co=
re of a sword is not folded as often as the
outside 'skin' for this reason =
- keeping it simple). 

I believe you will find that the average no. Of tim=
es the outer steel is
folded will range from 12 - 16. Indicating just over =
65.000 layers of
steel when folded 16 times.......... 

- Matt

this 
month on=

to be v=
ery informative and especially enjoyed the segment on sword
forging.

katanas having 1 million layers of metals!! Onegai let us know what
you 
th=
ought of it!-Keiman and Kei.

>would shatters blowing an slice at a bamboo,=

>Iai-do is able to slice an piece of bamboo in publi=
c with an very thin

!! "

word trainning (fencing) and

>and

hs of aprenticeship...
